it's about bash scripts and starting them at startup
for example, you could create a bash script that does  'hdparm -d1 /dev/cdrom', drop it into /etc/init.d, and use update-rc.d to add it to the /etc/rc2.d directory

how do I make it exacutable
sudo chmod u+x /etc/init.d/<whatever you named it>
then, sudo update-rc.d <whatever you named it> defaults
correction,  sudo update-rc.d <whatever you named it> defaults 99
netstat will show everything, even the local unix sockets.
